summary: REQ-1/2/3 are largely implemented via new reusable "lens-*" utility classes in global CSS and applied to the header title + desktop profile button and active dashboard tabs. REQ-4 is only partially met: the login button and three feature tiles get lens styling, but the rounded info panel under the login button does not, and an extra (non-requested) lens glow is applied to the entire Welcome card. Additionally, non-visual behavior was changed in the header theme toggle (localStorage/local-first + async backend save), which is outside the requested styling-only scope.

missing_requirements.requirement: Apply the animated Google Lens-style multicolor gradient glow styling to the rounded info panel under the login button (one of the four rounded areas on the welcome page).
missing_requirements.reason: The info panel div under the login button remains `rounded-lg bg-muted/50 p-4` without any `lens-*` class, while other areas received lens styling.
evidence: frontend/src/components/LoginScreen.tsx (info panel: `<div className="rounded-lg bg-muted/50 p-4">` lacks lens class)

hallucinated_features.description: Applied Lens-style surface glow styling to the entire Welcome card (Card wrapper), not just the rounded info panel + three feature tiles requested.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-4 specifies exactly four rounded areas: the info panel and three feature tiles. The diff adds `lens-surface-glow` to the main Card container (`<Card className="border-2 lens-surface-glow">`), which is an additional area beyond the specified four.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed theme toggle behavior to a local-first implementation that writes to localStorage and asynchronously persists theme preference.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is limited to visual styling updates only; adding localStorage persistence and changing theme update flow is a functional/behavioral change not requested.
evidence: frontend/src/components/Header.tsx (`toggleTheme` now calls `localStorage.setItem('bjj-theme', newTheme)` and conditionally `updateThemeMutation.mutate(newTheme)` with comments about local-first/async save)
